programme.title: 2025 NIT Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: UC Irvine (32-6) held on to beat North Texas, 69-67, to advance behind 16 points and 11 rebounds from Devin Tillis; Chattanooga (28-9) used a strong second half to defeat Loyola Chicago, 80-73, and advance behind 23 points from Trey Bonham.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: NCAA Women's Final Four Special
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at the NCAA Women's Basketball Final Four, as they discuss game-changing highlights, analyze the play of each school, profile top competitors, review offensive and defensive clips, and more.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's Basketball Tournament
programme.desc: Texas (35-3) makes its first Final Four appearance since 2003 after beating TCU, 58-47, behind 18 points from Madison Booker; South Carolina (34-3), the defending national champions, won two of its three season meetings with the Longhorns.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night
programme.desc: Josh Emmett (19-4-0) goes up against Lerone Murphy (15-0-1) in the featherweight main event; Pat Sabatini (19-5) faces Joanderson Brito (17-4-1) in a featherweight bout; Cortavious Romious (9-3) vs. ChangHo Lee (10-1) in a bantamweight bout.

programme.title: The Bird and Taurasi Show
programme.desc: Famed former WNBA players Sue Bird and Diana Taurasi offer an alternate telecast to women's basketball games, providing their unique commentary to the action on the court, along with interviews with celebrity guests to hear their thoughts.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Oscar Piastri secured his first win of 2025 with his victory at China over Lando Norris, who leads four-time defending champion Max Verstappen by eight points; Verstappen won the last three races at Japan after averaging 161.271 kph last year.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Houston (0-1) dropped its opener to St. Louis, 31-6, managing only 170 yards of offense, but defeated the Renegades last season, 17-9; Arlington (1-0) blew out San Antonio, 33-9, behind 110 rushing yards and a touchdown from Kalen Ballage.

programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at fighter training camps as they prepare for their marquee matchups on pay-per-view or other televised events to show how they train for the fight, and interviews with the fighters give a look inside the fighter's mind.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 8-ranked LSU is 9-4 all-time against No. 9-ranked Oklahoma after earning a 5-4 victory at the 2022 Shriners Hospitals for Children College Classic at Minute Maid Park in Houston, as Jordan Thompson hit a solo HR in the bottom of the 11th inning.

programme.title: Formula 1 Practice
programme.desc: Formula 1 drivers learn the intricacies of the track and communicate to the crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Japan; crews work to set up car.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: SEC teams prepare for their upcoming opponent with practice sessions and work inside the film room, featuring coaches drilling their players and offering advice, an exclusive look at how the schools game plan, and exclusive talks with team members.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Featured first-round welterweight bouts: Jason Jackson vs. Andrey Koreshkov; Magomed Umalatov vs. Logan Storley; Mukhamed Berkhamov vs. Florim Zendeli; featured featherweight bouts: Jesus Pinedo vs. Adam Borics; Jeremy Kennedy vs. Movlid Khaybulaev.

programme.title: Bad Beats
programme.desc: Scott Van Pelt and Stanford Steve delve into the rigors of the sports betting world by reliving some of the recent bad beats in recent games, from a last-second shot ruining the line to an over-under being erased due to scoring sprees or droughts.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of women's college basketball games.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: LSU claimed a 3-2, 14-inning victory against Alabama in the opening round of the 2024 SEC Tournament on May 8 with runs from Sierra Daniel, Mckenzie Redoutey and Raeleen Gutierrez; Kali Hevilin posted a game-leading 2 RBIs for the Tide in the loss.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of women's college basketball games.

programme.title: 2025 Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame Class Announcement
programme.desc: The 2025 class entering the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame is officially announced; Carmelo Anthony, Dwight Howard, Sue Bird, Maya Moore, Billy Donovan, Jennifer Azzi and Sylvia Fowles are some of the featured names under consideration.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of women's college basketball games.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Top fighters from around the world engage in a full-contact combat sport that allows a wide variety of fighting methods and skills from Mixed Martial Arts traditions as the fighters look to move up the rankings and stake claim to championship gold.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: Girls High School Basketball
programme.desc: Faith Family Academy/Montverde Academy winner faces the IMG Academy/Westtown School winner in the championship game of the annual tournament; Montverde Academy won the last three titles after beating IMG Academy in the 2024 final, 61-53.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: F1 drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Japanese Grand Prix, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Max Verstappen finished with an 88.197-second lap time last year to win his third-straight pole at Japan.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Arkansas claimed victories over Florida in two of three meetings from their last series in the 2023 season, winning the final matchup on March 26, 2023, with a 14-1 scoreline; Rylin Hedgecock posted 7 RBIs for the Razorbacks in the win.

programme.title: Goliath Fishing
programme.desc: James Marko travels across South Florida on fishing expeditions in hopes of reeling in trophy-caliber fish at each one of his stops, discussing the techniques he implements to find success out on the water and the equipment he uses to reel them in.

programme.title: SEC Inside
programme.desc: SEC teams prepare for their upcoming opponent with practice sessions and work inside the film room, featuring coaches drilling their players and offering advice, an exclusive look at how the schools game plan, and exclusive talks with team members.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Renowned fishing champion Jimmy Houston travels around the world fishing for largemouth bass, crappie and other fish, and he demonstrates his hunting techniques with other athletes, celebrities and friends who love to fish.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Christian Laettner used his brash and boisterous personality mixed with his on-court skills to become one of the most despised college basketball athletes in the history of the sport, as the documentary focuses on why he garnered those sentiments.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Despite losing to NC State in the 1983 NCAA Tournament final, Houston's Phi Slama Jama team, helmed by head coach Guy V. Lewis, was a legendary squad with the likes of Hakeem Olajuwon and Clyde Drexler leading the Cougars to deep tournament runs.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Christian Laettner used his brash and boisterous personality mixed with his on-court skills to become one of the most despised college basketball athletes in the history of the sport, as the documentary focuses on why he garnered those sentiments.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Duke claimed a 3-0 sweep against North Carolina in their lone series of the 2024 season, winning the final matchup on Apr. 7 with a 6-1 scoreline; Claire Davidson posted a game-leading 4 RBIs for the Blue Devils in the win at home.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: Texas entered the series having claimed an 11-1 victory over Missouri in their most recent meeting from the 2023 season behind 3 runs scored by Leighann Goode; four different players had 2 RBIs for the Longhorns in the win at the neutral site.

programme.title: Gr8tness
programme.desc: A record once thought to be untouchable, Alex Ovechkin gives an all-access look as he chases the 894 goals of the legendary Wayne Gretzky, showing how he prepares for his games and the pressure he is facing to break the prestigious record.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: Alex Gibney explores the fans' need to place the blame for difficult losses, as he examines the foul ball knocked from Moises Alou's hands by Steve Bartman and the ground ball that rolled through Bill Buckner's legs in the 1986 World Series.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Behind captain Mark Messier and goalie Mark Richter, the New York Rangers were in prime position in 1994 to give the team their first Stanley Cup title since 1940, using inspiration from paralyzed NYPD officer Steven McDonald to make their run.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Dave Gavitt, a former basketball coach at Providence, was the driving force behind the creation of the Big East Conference in 1979, which flourished in the 1980s and became one of the most highly respected basketball conferences in the country.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1983, North Carolina State suffered 10 losses in the regular season and had to overcome national powerhouses to win the ACC Tournament and qualify for the NCAA Tournament, where the Wolfpack mounted a memorable run to the national championship.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Villanova (20-14) defeated Colorado, 85-64, to advance behind 24 points from Wooga Poplar and 22 from Eric Dixon; USC (17-17) blew out Tulane, 89-60, behind 27 points and nine rebounds from Rashaun Agee, along with 14 points from Saint Thomas.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Cincinnati (19-15) blew out DePaul, 83-61, to advance, and beat the Knights during the season, 93-83, on Feb. 5 behind 20 points from Day Day Thomas; UCF (18-16) held on to beat Oregon State, 76-75, behind a Tyler Hendricks double-double.

programme.desc: Analysts recap the recent College Basketball Crown game, breaking down highlights of the key moments and postgame interviews, and preview the upcoming matchup with the key players to watch on both teams and their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: UFL Football

programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Day
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Goodyear 400 and Denny Hamlin, who secured his first win of the season with his victory at Martinsville over Christopher Bell, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: St. Louis went 7-3 last season to win the XFL Conference, including a 22-8 win over the Roughnecks on May 4 behind 134 receiving yards and two touchdowns from Hakeem Butler; Houston dropped its last six games to finish the 2024 season at 1-9.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio missed winning the XFL Conference last season via a tiebreaker after going 7-3, including a 25-16 road win over the Renegades on April 27 behind John Lovett; Arlington won its last two games of the 2024 campaign but finished 3-7.

programme.title: 2025 College Basketball Crown
programme.desc: Villanova (20-14) defeated Colorado, 85-64, to advance behind 24 points from Wooga Poplar and 22 from Eric Dixon; USC (17-17) blew out Tulane, 89-60, behind 27 points and nine rebounds from Rashaun Agee, along with 14 points from Saint Thomas.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Inter Miami CF has won just one of the three all-time encounters but won the last meeting, 3-1, on Sept. 3, 2023, as Lionel Messi had two assists in the second half; Los Angeles FC was the runner-up to Tigres UANL in 2020 and León in 2023.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Women's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: The four highest-seeded teams from the region (United States, Mexico, Canada and Haiti) awaited 22 teams competing in the first round for the final eight spots; the US has won the competition six times while Mexico has the most runner-ups with five.

programme.title: The Rover of Tobruk
programme.desc: The life of Bob Quinn was much more than becoming a legend and captain for the Port Adelaide Football Club, serving his country of Australia during World War II and receiving the Military Medal for his actions during the Siege of Tobruk.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Melbourne (0-3-0) snapped a two-match winless streak to the Cats with a 74-66 victory at MCG last season, as Bayley Fritsch kicked a club-high three goals; Geelong (1-2-0) has lost two in a row after falling to Brisbane, 70-61, on March 29.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres UANL has reached the final four times since its runner-up finish in the 2015-16 edition; LA Galaxy, the winner of the 2000 tournament, defeated Herediano, 4-1, on March 12 to advance; inaugural meeting between the two clubs.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
